item.title: 01-bits-and-bytes
item.description: What is data A fact — a piece of information corresponds to discreete facts about phenomena from which we gain information abou the world The concept of a value is fundamental to data e.

item.title: cosc-204
item.description: page Assignments Notes By completion of this paper students are expected to: Hardware Understand how programs are executed on computer hardware memory Assembly Demonstrate an ability to read and write assembly language programs C Be able to construct programs in C and understand its role as a systems programming language Operating systems Understand the fundamental principles and structure of an operating system OS Algorithms Understand core operating systems algorithms such as process scheduling and resource allocation and management Use of Resources Be aware of the importance of efficient use of resources from computational, economic, and environmental viewpoints Lectures 01-bits-and-bytes Archive Info

item.title: digital-data
item.description: What is data A fact — a piece of information corresponds to discreete facts about phenomena from which we gain information abou the world The concept of a value is fundamental to data e.

item.title: memory
item.description: Computer memory is a series of switches (similar to the switchboard in a house). Each switch is identified by a number and is either on or off.
